author: Biggie Smalls
text: Well the sunglasses I ordered were pretty long, but the sunglasses were not packed in anything from keeping them to be damaged. The sunglasses were sent in a big box and were stored in the real real bag. I feel like the sunglasses could have been damaged. Luckily they were not. I recommend packing accessories with bubble wrap or something else to keep them from harms way when being shipped.

author: customer
text:
The dress was exactly as described, except the picture wasn't at all color accurate. I understand that screens can vary, but it was the difference between a soft royal blue (pictured) and a gray, baby blue (actual item).

If the customers shouldn't rely on the pictures to determine the color of an item, the description should at least list whether the color is light, medium, or dark.

I will be keeping the because the color is acceptable for the event I am attending and I don't want to deal with the hassle of returning ti, but I definitely wouldn't have purchased it had I known how light the color is.
title: The dress was exactly as described

author: customer
text:
It’s took over 6 weeks to list all of my items. 

It’s took 5 plus emails to figure out what was going on. Zero communication. No follow up. My Rep never even emailed me back when I emailed stating that my largest item still hadn’t listed on week 6. So I had to call in , which took forever because of wait times. Took another two weeks to get an answer. 

You really need to get better at the listing process. And you should also consider lessening the option for returns. If a seller has to wait 6-7 weeks to list. Plus wait if the buyer returns their item. It could be 4-5 months before they’re paid out. 

Fashionfile paid me in 4 days. Once they received my items. I will not sell again with TRR.

text: I bought a silk blouse that was listed as pristine condition. When the blouse arrived, you could clearly tell the blouse had been worn, and the previous owner just tied the tags to the shirt. I understand that this company receives a lot of clothing to review. But it was something I noticed as soon as I saw the blouse. The main reason why I bought the blouse was because of the condition it was listed as. It’s disappointing because the last few items I’ve purchased haven’t been as good of quality as they were listed as.

author: Jane
text: Two bad experiences: the Tory Burch dress I bought was in fact an Alice & Olivia dress. Clearly labeled. Next: I bought two Emilio Pucci scarves described as 100% silk. Both were actually just cotton scarves. Sending both back and managed to at least get TRR to pay for return shipping. No apology or explanation on their end. I’m done trusting their site.
title: Two bad experiences
